verses.verse: And the LORD<WH3068> spake<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872>, saying<WH559>,

Speak<WH1696> unto the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, and say<WH559> unto them, When a man<WH376> shall make a singular<WH6381> vow<WH5088>, the persons<WH5315> shall be for the LORD<WH3068> by thy estimation<WH6187>.

And thy estimation<WH6187> shall be of the male<WH2145> from twenty<WH6242> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> even unto sixty<WH8346> years<WH8141> old<WH1121>, even thy estimation<WH6187> shall be fifty<WH2572> shekels<WH8255> of silver<WH3701>, after the shekel<WH8255> of the sanctuary<WH6944>.
And if it be a female<WH5347>, then thy estimation<WH6187> shall be thirty<WH7970> shekels<WH8255>.

And if it be from five<WH2568> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> even unto twenty<WH6242> years<WH8141> old<WH1121>, then thy estimation<WH6187> shall be of the male<WH2145> twenty<WH6242> shekels<WH8255>, and for the female<WH5347> ten<WH6235> shekels<WH8255>.

And if it be from a month<WH2320> old<WH1121> even unto five<WH2568> years<WH8141> old<WH1121>, then thy estimation<WH6187> shall be of the male<WH2145> five<WH2568> shekels<WH8255> of silver<WH3701>, and for the female<WH5347> thy estimation<WH6187> shall be three<WH7969> shekels<WH8255> of silver<WH3701>.

And if it be from sixty<WH8346> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> and above<WH4605>; if it be a male<WH2145>, then thy estimation<WH6187> shall be fifteen<WH2568> <WH6240> shekels<WH8255>, and for the female<WH5347> ten<WH6235> shekels<WH8255>.

But if he be poorer<WH4134> than thy estimation<WH6187>, then he shall present<WH5975> himself before<WH6440> the priest<WH3548>, and the priest<WH3548> shall value<WH6186> him; according to<WH6310> his ability<WH3027> <WH5381> that vowed<WH5087> shall the priest<WH3548> value<WH6186> him.
And if it be a beast<WH929>, whereof men bring<WH7126> an offering<WH7133> unto the LORD<WH3068>, all that any man giveth<WH5414> of such unto the LORD<WH3068> shall be holy<WH6944>.

He shall not alter<WH2498> it, nor change<WH4171> it, a good<WH2896> for a bad<WH7451>, or a bad<WH7451> for a good<WH2896>: and if he shall at all<WH4171> change<WH4171> beast<WH929> for beast<WH929>, then it and the exchange<WH8545> thereof shall be holy<WH6944>.

And if it be any unclean<WH2931> beast<WH929>, of which they do not offer<WH7126> a sacrifice<WH7133> unto the LORD<WH3068>, then he shall present<WH5975> the beast<WH929> before<WH6440> the priest<WH3548>:

And the priest<WH3548> shall value<WH6186> it, whether<WH996> it be good<WH2896> or<WH996> bad<WH7451>: as thou valuest<WH6187> it, who art the priest<WH3548>, so shall it be. as: Heb. according to thy estimation, O priest, etc
But if he will at all<WH1350> redeem<WH1350> it, then he shall add<WH3254> a fifth<WH2549> part thereof unto thy estimation<WH6187>.

And when a man<WH376> shall sanctify<WH6942> his house<WH1004> to be holy<WH6944> unto the LORD<WH3068>, then the priest<WH3548> shall estimate<WH6186> it, whether it be good<WH2896> or bad<WH7451>: as the priest<WH3548> shall estimate<WH6186> it, so shall it stand<WH6965>.

And if he that sanctified<WH6942> it will redeem<WH1350> his house<WH1004>, then he shall add<WH3254> the fifth<WH2549> part of the money<WH3701> of thy estimation<WH6187> unto it, and it shall be his.

And if a man<WH376> shall sanctify<WH6942> unto the LORD<WH3068> some part of a field<WH7704> of his possession<WH272>, then thy estimation<WH6187> shall be according<WH6310> to the seed<WH2233> thereof: an homer<WH2563> of barley<WH8184> seed<WH2233> shall be valued at fifty<WH2572> shekels<WH8255> of silver<WH3701>. an: or, the land of an homer, etc
If he sanctify<WH6942> his field<WH7704> from the year<WH8141> of jubile<WH3104>, according to thy estimation<WH6187> it shall stand<WH6965>.

But if he sanctify<WH6942> his field<WH7704> after<WH310> the jubile<WH3104>, then the priest<WH3548> shall reckon<WH2803> unto him the money<WH3701> according to<WH6310> the years<WH8141> that remain<WH3498>, even unto the year<WH8141> of the jubile<WH3104>, and it shall be abated<WH1639> from thy estimation<WH6187>.

And if he that sanctified<WH6942> the field<WH7704> will in any wise<WH1350> redeem<WH1350> it, then he shall add<WH3254> the fifth<WH2549> part of the money<WH3701> of thy estimation<WH6187> unto it, and it shall be assured<WH6965> to him.
And if he will not redeem<WH1350> the field<WH7704>, or if he have sold<WH4376> the field<WH7704> to another<WH312> man<WH376>, it shall not be redeemed<WH1350> any more.

But the field<WH7704>, when it goeth out<WH3318> in the jubile<WH3104>, shall be holy<WH6944> unto the LORD<WH3068>, as a field<WH7704> devoted<WH2764>; the possession<WH272> thereof shall be the priest's<WH3548>.
And if a man sanctify<WH6942> unto the LORD<WH3068> a field<WH7704> which he hath bought<WH4736>, which is not of the fields<WH7704> of his possession<WH272>;

Then the priest<WH3548> shall reckon<WH2803> unto him the worth<WH4373> of thy estimation<WH6187>, even unto the year<WH8141> of the jubile<WH3104>: and he shall give<WH5414> thine estimation<WH6187> in that day<WH3117>, as a holy thing<WH6944> unto the LORD<WH3068>.
In the year<WH8141> of the jubile<WH3104> the field<WH7704> shall return<WH7725> unto him of whom it was bought<WH7069>, even to him to whom the possession<WH272> of the land<WH776> did belong.
And all thy estimations<WH6187> shall be according to the shekel<WH8255> of the sanctuary<WH6944>: twenty<WH6242> gerahs<WH1626> shall be the shekel<WH8255>.

Only the firstling<WH1060> of the beasts<WH929>, which should be the LORD'S<WH3068> firstling<WH1069>, no man<WH376> shall sanctify<WH6942> it; whether it be ox<WH7794>, or sheep<WH7716>: it is the LORD'S<WH3068>. firstling of: Heb. firstborn, etc

And if it be of an unclean<WH2931> beast<WH929>, then he shall redeem<WH6299> it according to thine estimation<WH6187>, and shall add<WH3254> a fifth<WH2549> part of it thereto: or if it be not redeemed<WH1350>, then it shall be sold<WH4376> according to thy estimation<WH6187>.

Notwithstanding no devoted thing<WH2764>, that a man<WH376> shall devote<WH2763> unto the LORD<WH3068> of all that he hath, both of man<WH120> and beast<WH929>, and of the field<WH7704> of his possession<WH272>, shall be sold<WH4376> or redeemed<WH1350>: every devoted thing<WH2764> is most<WH6944> holy<WH6944> unto the LORD<WH3068>.
None devoted<WH2764>, which shall be<WH3808> devoted<WH2763> of men<WH120>, shall be redeemed<WH6299>; but shall surely<WH4191> be put to death<WH4191>.

And all the tithe<WH4643> of the land<WH776>, whether of the seed<WH2233> of the land<WH776>, or of the fruit<WH6529> of the tree<WH6086>, is the LORD'S<WH3068>: it is holy<WH6944> unto the LORD<WH3068>.
And if a man<WH376> will at all<WH1350> redeem<WH1350> ought of his tithes<WH4643>, he shall add<WH3254> thereto the fifth<WH2549> part thereof.
And concerning the tithe<WH4643> of the herd<WH1241>, or of the flock<WH6629>, even of whatsoever passeth<WH5674> under the rod<WH7626>, the tenth<WH6224> shall be holy<WH6944> unto the LORD<WH3068>.

He shall not search<WH1239> whether it be good<WH2896> or bad<WH7451>, neither shall he change<WH4171> it: and if he change<WH4171> it at all<WH4171>, then both it and the change<WH8545> thereof shall be holy<WH6944>; it shall not be redeemed<WH1350>.
These are the commandments<WH4687>, which the LORD<WH3068> commanded<WH6680> Moses<WH4872> for the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> in mount<WH2022> Sinai<WH5514>.
